tn.text: This means to look up at something. AT: "looked up" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: two mountains were made of bronze
tn.text: "two mountains were bronze" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"chariot 1 ... chariot 2"

tn.ref: These are the four winds of heaven
tn.text: The angel explains that the chariots with horses are symbols for the 4 winds of heaven.
The word "winds" refers to the four directions: north, east, south, and west. However, some modern versions interpret this Hebrew expression to mean "four spirits."

tn.ref: the white horses are going out to the west country
tn.text: Some modern versions interpret this Hebrew phrase to mean "the white horses are going out after them."
"Look at the black horses"
"Yahweh spoke his word." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:zec:01:01|1:1]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
These are the names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: Then take the silver and gold, make a crown
tn.text: AT: Then use the silver and the gold to make a crown. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This is not the same man who was Moses' helper; this is the high priest from the book of Haggai.
AT: "Yahweh told the angel to speak to Zechariah and say"
The angel of Yahweh gives this name to the new king Joshua. Translate this name as you did in [[:en:bible:notes:zec:03:08|3:8]].
The phrase "grow up" is a word picture of branch beginning to sprout. AT: "He will sprout"
Possible meanings: 1) "increase the temple's splendor" or 2) "lift up and put on the temple's splendor for himself like a person might put on clothing"

tn.ref: the understanding of peace will exist between the two
tn.text: AT: "his roles of king and priest will be united" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: A crown will be placed in the temple of Yahweh
tn.text: AT: "I will place a crown in my temple" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
The word "crown" refers to a king as a king would wear a crown. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: placed in the temple of Yahweh
tn.text: This phrase refers to the king also being a priest, as a priest serves in the temple.
See how these names were translated in [[:en:bible:notes:zec:06:09|6:10]].

tn.ref: as a memorial to the generosity of the son of Zephaniah
tn.text: Some modern versions interpret this phrase as "as a memorial to Hen, son of Zephaniah" or "as a memorial to the one who is gracious, the son of Zephaniah." Also, some modern versions interpret the name "Hen" as meaning the name "Josiah."
This refers to the Israelites who remain in Babylon. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
The word "you" refers to the people of Israel.
"listen sincerely"
